intro: Ruschia clavellata, commonly known as the clustered Ruschia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features small, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color, arranged in dense clusters. The plant produces showy, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, or red during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in arid and semi-arid regions.
